docs.title: Home
docs.text: Welcome to my personal technical portfolio. This site is dedicated to connecting Traditional Actuarial Application with Cutting-Edge Data Science and Machine Learning methodologies, presenting a series of complete end-to-end project analyses.

docs.title: 1. 🔍 Traditional Actuarial & Financial Modeling
docs.text: In-depth explorations of traditional methods in key financial domains, with a focus on: * General Insurance: Pricing mechanisms (e.g.Glms) and liability valuation. * Banking & Credit: Application of financial models for credit risk assessment and default prediction (e.g., PD, LGD).

docs.title: 2. 🤖 Big Data & Machine Learning Applications
docs.text: Practical application and comparison of various advanced statistical algorithms to enhance forecasting accuracy and insight across the fields listed above: * Hands-on implementation of Gradient Boosting Machines (GBM), XGBoost, and neural networks for improved risk classification and loss prediction. * Comparative analysis of traditional methods versus modern machine learning enhancements. * Building deployable analytical pipelines using Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, Azure,etc.).

docs.title: 3. ✨ Modern AI Exploration and Automation
docs.text: Exploring the future of financial analytics by integrating next-generation technology: * Experimenting with Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI Agents to automate actuarial and financial reporting workflows. * Focus on improving efficiency and data processing capabilities using advanced automation tools.

docs.title: 4. 📚 Actuarial Education & Tool Sharing
docs.text: A dedicated section for educational content, exam preparation, and practical tool tutorials: * Actuarial Exam Preparation: Sharing study strategies and core concepts. * Common Tool Teaching: Tutorials and best practices for essential tools like Python, SQL, SAS, and PowerBI in financial and insurance analytics.

docs.title: 🔎 Project Structure
docs.text:
To ensure a comprehensive learning experience, every project documented here follows a consistent and complete structure. Each case study provides:

  • Real-World Context: The business problem and background story.
  • Data Availability: Sample datasets (synthetic or anonymized) for replication.
  • End-to-End Workflow: The full analytical process, from initial raw data cleaning to final modeling and result presentation.
  • Tool Agnostic: Examples and solutions leveraging multiple industry tools, including Python, SAS, SQL, and Excel.

docs.title: ⬇️ Downloading Project Files
docs.text:
You are encouraged to download and experiment with the code yourself!

To get all associated project files:

  1. Navigate to the last page of any specific project.
  2. Look for and click the "Download All Files" button (or link) located at the bottom of the page.
  3. This will provide a ZIP archive containing all necessary notebooks, scripts, workbooks, and datasets.

Feel free to use, modify, or learn from anything here for your own practice or research.
